decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing Cloudpost and ramping up mana quickly to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Emrakul, the Promised End. The deck also includes disruption elements like Thought-Knot Seer and counterspells to control the game. The key strategy is to quickly assemble the necessary mana base and cast game-ending threats that are difficult for opponents to deal with. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its powerful creatures and mana advantage, making it a formidable force in the Legacy format.

The main focus of this Legacy Merfolk aggro deck is to establish a strong board presence early on with powerful lords like Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and disruptive creatures like Tide Shaper. The inclusion of True-Name Nemesis provides a difficult to deal with threat, while Aether Vial allows for cheating creatures into play at instant speed. Wasteland provides additional disruption to slow down the opponent, while Sink into Stupor can help control the opponent's hand.

The deck focuses on using powerful reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to cheat out big creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier early in the game. It also utilizes disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Daze to protect its combo pieces and control the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck runs a variety of counter spells like Force of Will to protect its own creatures and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The mana base is built to support the deck's multi-color requirements and includes a strong land destruction package with Wasteland.

The main objective of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful spells while disrupting their game plan with countermagic and land destruction. Using cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent, the deck aims to apply early pressure and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. By combining efficient creatures with disruptive spells like Daze and Force of Will, the deck seeks to control the tempo of the game and prevent the opponent from mounting a successful defense.
